long_desc.thetext:
Latest upstream release: 3.4.3.1
Current version in Fedora Rawhide: 3.4.2
URL: http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/downloads.php

Please consult the package updates policy before you issue an update to a stable branch: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Updates_Policy

More information about the service that created this bug can be found at:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Upstream_release_monitoring

phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.fc15 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 15.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.fc15

phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.fc14 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 14.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.fc14

phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.el6 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 6.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.el6

Package phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.el6:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=epel-testing phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.el6'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.el6
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.fc14 has been pushed to the Fedora 14 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.fc15 has been pushed to the Fedora 15 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by robert.
This update has been pushed to testing
Installed fine, basic test went OK
This update has reached the stable karma threshold and will be pushed to the stable updates repository
This update has been pushed to stable

notes:
Changes for 3.4.3.1 (2011-06-07)

- [PMASA-2011-5] Possible session manipulation in Swekey authentication (http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2011-5.php)
- [PMASA-2011-6] Possible code injection in setup script in case session variables are compromised (http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2011-6.php)
- [PMASA-2011-7] Regular expression quoting issue in Synchronize code (http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2011-7.php)
- [PMASA-2011-8] Possible directory traversal (http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2011-8.php)


Changes for 3.4.3.0 (2011-06-27)

- [sync] Missing helper icons in Synchronize
- [setup] Redefine a lable that was wrong
- [parser] master is not a reserved word
- [edit] Inline edit updates multiple duplicate rows
- [edit] Inline edit does not escape backslashes
- [interface] Columns class sometimes changed for nothing
- [interface] Some tooltips do not disappear
- [search] Fix search in non unicode tables
- [display] Inline query edit broken
- [privileges] Generate password option missing on new accounts
- [edit] Inline edit places HTML line breaks in edit area
- [interface] Inline query edit does not escape special characters
- [security] minor XSS (require a valid token)
title: phpMyAdmin-3.4.3.1-1.el6
